rComments: It's a hard class that has it's dull moments if you're not into doing the reading or trying to follow, but Hicks tries to makes things easier to understand. He's laid back and cracks jokes and overall pretty cool. But he does expect readings to be done because he kinda just jumps into lessons.

Hicks is a pretty funny and cool guy, however I feel that he does not engage the class. Most lectures are pretty dull and his rambling eventually confuses everyone. If you're really interested in Philosophy and you love to read, take this class. If you're slightly interested, keep in mind there is a huge time demand.

Logic is a hard subject that requires a lot of hours on your own, no matter who is teaching. Hicks is friendly, humorous, and considerate. He does have high expectations of attendance homework, so don't disappoint him. He is very approachable outside of class.

Professor Hicks is a fantastic teacher. He knows his subject very well. He can be a hard teacher and the readings can be hard, but they are suppose to be. If college were easy then the teacher's wouldn't be doing their job. Hicks explains his material for class very well and is very clear. He is very approachable and easy to talk to.

Hicks is a really nice/ funny guy but he is one of those people not meant to be a teacher. I sometimes felt he forgot that this was an intro class... Poor explanations and really boring/unhelpful lectures, the only reason I passed was because of the TA Ryan's review sessions! overall would NOT recommend the class
really difficult to understand, unless you already are familiar with the material. lectures are mandatory and the homework is really difficult

The subject is hard but I found (mandatory) lectures relatively easy to understand. Plus, he's funny! Go to class, utilize tutors, do your homework and you'll be fine! One midterm, one final and (almost) weekly homework assignments. Probably shouldn't take this class if you don't NEED it.
He's a great person and good teacher, especially for such a difficult subject. He has a sense of humor and he's really cute too and has a nice smile. I recommend him to anyone who NEEDS this class.

He isn't much help when you ask and logic is just a difficult subject to understand in general, so he doesn't help make it any easier. In fact, being in class really burdened my learning because he'll go on tangents about questions that are asked and dance around the straight answer. Just be willing to teach yourself a lot.
